text: The Matterhorn (in German; , or Le Cervin) is ranked, by height, 12th mountain in the European Alps.Even though the Matterhorn is very famous, both because of its beauty, and because it is hard to climb, it is not one of the 100 tallest mountains in the Alps. Several mountains near it, including Monte Rosa, the Dom, Liskamm and the Weisshorn, are taller. Its height is 4,478 metres.NHK, "Matterhorn: Majestic Peak that Pierces the Sky -- Switzerland, 4,478 m"; retrieved 2012-5-24. The mountain is on the border between Switzerland and Italy, it towers over the Swiss village of Zermatt and the Italian village Breuil-Cervinia in the Val Tournanche. The name of the mountain comes from the German words Matte, meaning valley or meadow, and Horn, which means peak.Swiss Mountains - Names www.swissworld.org Retrieved 26 November 2007. ==References== *Charles Gos, Le Cervin (Attinger, 1948) *Edward Whymper, Scrambles Amongst the Alps (1871) Notes == Other websites == *Virtual ascent of the HÃ¶rnli Ridge with 360 degree panoramas *Alpinist Magazine Mountain Profile - Issue 16 *Matterhorn Webcams *Matterhorn on Summitpost *PeakWare info on Matterhorn *Matterhorn on 4000er.de *Walt Disney and Zermatt *Chronology of climbs - in German *Photo gallery dedicated to Matterhorn and surrounding nature Category:Alps Category:Mountains of Italy Category:Mountains of Switzerland Category:Geography of Valais
title: Matterhorn
